remarks: If ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` , ` ps ` , and ` ch ` , it is not free in ` ( ph \/ ps \/ ch ) ` .  (Contributed by NM, 14-Sep-2003.)
statement:
hb.1 $e |- ( ph -> A. x ph ) $.
hb.2 $e |- ( ps -> A. x ps ) $.
hb.3 $e |- ( ch -> A. x ch ) $.
hb3or $p |- ( ( ph \/ ps \/ ch ) -> A. x ( ph \/ ps \/ ch ) ) $.
